alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 14 at 6:15PM PDT until May 20 at 7:13PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures for the upcoming week will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Flooding begins on Customs Road near mile post 6. At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Monday afternoon. The river is forecast to crest around 19.0 feet Wednesday and then remain between 18.5 and 19.0 feet through Saturday. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 615 AM PDT.
